(Simplified: 钗)
Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: A metal 釒 fork 叉; 叉 also provides the pronunciation
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 釒 [ jīn ] gold, metal; money
    • 叉 [ chā ] fork; prong; cross, intersect
①婦女的一種首飾，由兩股簪子合成：金釵。玉釵。裙釵(舊指婦女。亦稱“釵裙”)。荊釵布裙(形容婦女裝束樸素)。
釵光鬢影 [ chāi guāng bìn yǐng ]: glistening hair decorations (of a woman or girl) (idiom)
釵荊裙布 [ chāi jīng qún bù ]: a thorn for a hair-pin, and plain cloth for a skirt; very plainly dressed (of a girl) (idiom)
(Simplified: 钗)

釵字的基本解释

釵
chāi
见“钗”。

釵字的汉语字典释义

[①]［chāi］
［《廣韻》楚佳切，平佳，初。］
亦作“叉5”。“钗1”的繁体字。
(1)钗子。
(2)指妇女。

釵字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　釵； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页1297第11
【唐韻】楚佳切【集韻】【韻會】初佳切，?音叉。【說文】筓屬。本只作叉，此字後人所加。【玉篇】婦人岐筓也。【司馬相如·美人賦】玉釵挂臣冠。【秦嘉·與婦徐淑書】今致寶釵一雙，可耀首。【曹植·美女篇】頭上金爵釵。　又金釵股，藥名。【本草綱目】李時珍曰：石斛，狀似金釵，故名。又忍冬藤，解毒。亦號金釵股。　又【韻補】叶稱支切，音鴟。【繁欽·定情詩】何以慰別離，耳後玳瑁釵。　又叶千古切，音楚。【毛詩·註疏】欲買赭，不謂竈下有黃土。欲買釵，不謂山中自有楛。

釵字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

釵字的起名意思

暂无。

[①]［chāi］
["Guang Yun" Chu Jiaqie, Ping Jia, Chu. ]
Also known as "Fork 5". Traditional characters for "钗1".
(1) Chaizi.
(2) Refers to women.
hairpin
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Su Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　 Chai; Kangxi Strokes: 11; Page Number: Page 1297 No. 11
[Tang Yun] Chu Jia cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Early Jia cut,? Tuning fork. [Said the text] Jun is the genus. This book is only used as a cross, and this word was added by later generations. 【Jade articles】Women Qi Jun also. 【Sima Xiangru·Beauty Fu】The jade hairpin hangs the crown of the minister. 【Qin Jia·Book with His wife Xu Shu】This is a pair of treasure hairpins, which can be the first. 【Cao Zhi·Beauty Article】Golden Jue Chai on his head.　The gold hairpin stock, the name of the medicine. 【Compendium of Materia Medica】Li Shizhen said: Dendrobium is like a golden hairpin, hence the name. And honeysuckle vine, detoxification. Also numbered gold hairpin stocks.　[Rhyme Supplement] Ye said branch cut, sound 鸱. 【Fanqin·Love Poem】Why can we comfort the parting, the tortoiseshell hairpin behind the ear.　 Ye Qiangu cut again, Yin Chu. [Mao Shi·Notes] If you want to buy ocher, it does not mean that there is loess under the stove. If you want to buy hairpins, you don't have to be in the mountains.
